title.narrative: Improve WASH services in schools- Khartoum State

description.narrative: Poor WASH services in schools lead to increase number of school dropout especially among the girls. This situation has urged CAFOD organization to conduct WASH in school ( Wins) assessment for eleven basic schools in rural area in Karrari , Umbada , and Sharg Elnile localities at Khartoum state. The objective of the assessment was to identify the WASH situation and to identify areas of intervention aiming to improve WASH services in rural schools. The assessment discovered that all assessed schools have poor hygiene practices, lack of solid waste management, have access to sanitation but insufficient compare to the number of students while 50 percent do not have access to safe drinking water. Also discovered the design of existing WASH facilities in these schools did not consider the students with disabilities. Project output include: Out put 1:Improvement of sanitation and hygiene practices in rural basic schools. Activity 1.1. Construction of 12 drop holes’ latrine in 3 schools (4 drop holes in each school) Activity 1.2. Construction of Hand washing facilities in 8 schools Activity 1.3. Rehabilitation of 6 schools’ latrines. Activity 1.4. Construction of Incinerator in 11 schools Activity 1.5. Provide cleaning tools , cups , Ibrig for toilet for 11 schools. Activity 1.6. Establishment of schools clubs and enhance hygiene practices among students through drama , leaflets , cinema , songs in 11 schools 2- Out put 2:Increase access to safe water supply to basic schools in rural area .
